name: CONSORZIO STABILE GLOSSA
goal:
The Glossa Consortium is a Research Organization under Regulation (EC) No 651/2014.
Established in 1996, to develop research activities finalized in the application of computer technologies in the human sciences sector, the Consortium’s goal is to 1) carry out research activities applied to the field of information technologies and of advanced network technologies, finalized towards identifying methods and production of cutting edge information solutions, with special reference to the sectors of cataloging, preservation and use of cultural and environmental assets, of tourist promotion, environmental protection and planning of the territory, of multimedia and e-publishing, of computer “aided” translations; 2) carry out training and refresher activities finalized towards training and professional valorization of human resources in the areas of responsibility of the Consortium; 3) foster interaction among Universities, Research bodies and agencies, both national and international, in the fields of economic, cultural and social interest, ensuring the exchange of information and know.
The entire structure, which is based on the status of its own professional resources and/or those of consortium members, is mainly directed at R&D activities. The main and most equipped laboratory of R&S is located at the CRBC Regional Center for Cultural Heritage of Campania , set up in the Castel dell’Ovo (Via Eldorado n°1) in Naples with 10 staff (nr.1 Management, nr.1 Administration, nr.4 System analyst, nr.4 Programmer analysts) facility of 400 sq.m equipped with a computer center, the CRBC, with 15 workstations and an efficient server room (with 10 servers, 2 Tbyte of storage and a network link of 20 Mbit) through which services and resources are provided to the Public administrations (both Central and Local) that operate on the territory on matters of Cultural heritage.
Since 2004, due to an appropriate Memorandum of Understanding undersigned with the Ministry of Cultural Heritage and Activities and due to a R&S project financed by MIUR (PON 2000-2006) the consortium realizes and manages the CRBC regional Center for the Cultural Heritage of the Campania region (www.campaniacrbc.it) with the task of gathering and consolidating and managing within a single information system all the information on the cultural heritage of Campania. This activity has allowed realizing a data bank, at the regional level, structured and computerized the information assets of the catalog present at the Superintendents of the territory, the Towns and regional Administration.
